loans.name: Gregoria Magdalena

texts.es:
Picoaza consta en los libros como uno de los pueblos aborígenes parte de la cultura manteña, esta parroquia urbana situada a tan solo diez minutos de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital manabita está llena de muchas historias aquí se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal María Asunción.

La señora Magdalena tiene 58 años de edad, esta casada y tiene tres hijos, todos mayores de edad y ya casados, en su casa vive un nieto de 10 años que es como si fuera su hijo menor y al cual adora, su marido es comerciante, vende jugos y colas en el centro.

Tiene un pequeño puesto de comida en su casa, prepara empanadas, corviches y algunas variedades de platos, trabaja todos los días desde las 16h00 hasta las 19h00 en la venta, pero, en la preparación desde las 12h00.
 
Este crédito es para comprar  mesas y sillas que le hacen falta y  alimentos para la preparación de la comida.
Esta en el Banco Comunal hace más de 10 años y esta muy contenta con la ayuda que ha recibido de la Fundación Espoir.
 
Su sueño es tener un negocio más grande
texts.en:
There are records of Picoaza as one of the aboriginal settlements of the Manta people. It is an urban parish, situated just 10 minutes from the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí province, and it is full of history. It is also where the members of the María Asunción Communal Bank meet every 5 days.

Señora Magdalena is 58 years old. She is married and has three children, themselves grown up and married now. Her 10 year old grandson lives with her, however, and she adores him. Her husband is a businessman, selling juices and soft drinks in the city centre.

She has a small eatery in her house, where she serves empanadas, corviche and other local dishes. She works every day, selling from 4pm-7pm but preparing food from 12 noon. 

This loan is to buy tables and chairs, which she doesn't have at present, and ingredients for preparing her food. She has been in the Communal Bank for over 10 years and is very happy with the support she has received from Fundación Espoir.
 
Her dream is to have a larger business.

loans.use: To buy tables, chairs and ingredients

loans.name: Dany Daniel

texts.es:
Dany es un padre de familia de 26 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el caserío C. Blanca del distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola que produce principalmente limón, mango y maracuyá, se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de carga y pasajeros en una mototaxi (vehículo de transporte consistente en una motocicleta que lleva anexada una cabina), el brinda su servicio cubriendo la ruta que une el pueblo de Olmos con el caserío Callejón de Cascajal, esta actividad tiene bastante acogida ya que las mototaxis constituyen el único medio de transporte que une ambas zonas.

Adicionalmente Dany se vale de su mototaxi para vender frutas en Callejón de Cascajal dos días a la semana. Con estas actividades el se encarga de solventar los gastos de su familia y tratar de sacarlos adelante.

Dany desea realizar algunas reparaciones en su vehículo ya que este ha empezado a sufrir algunas fallas producto del excesivo uso y del mal estado de las carreteras de la zona, para realizar esta acción ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.

El es una persona bastante trabajadora y bastante conocida y estimada por los pobladores de la zona. Anteriormente ya ha tenido créditos vigentes con Edpyme Alternativa y ha demostrado responsabilidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Dany is a 26 year-old father who lives with his wife and their children in the rural C. Blanca settlement in the Olmos district, an agricultural area where they mainly grow lemons, mangoes and passion fruit.  This area is located in the Lambayeque province, more than 2 hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Dany provides cargo and passenger transportation services in a mototaxi (a transport vehicle that consists of a motorcycle that has a cabin attached.)  He provides service along the route that connects the town of Olmos to the Callejon de Cascajal settlement.  This activity is well received by the public, since mototaxis are the only means of transportation in both areas.

In addition, Dany uses his mototaxi to sell fruit in Callejon de Cascajal 2 days a week.  With these activities, he covers the household expenses and provides for his family.

Dany wants to make some repairs to his vehicle, since it is starting to have some mechanical problems due to excessive use and the bad state of the roads in the area.  To do this, he is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 Peruvian soles.

He is a very hardworking person who is well known and appreciated by the residents of the area.  In his previous loans from Edpyme Alternativa, he demonstrated responsibility in making his payments.

loans.use: to repair and maintain his mototaxi

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Mrs. Yim S. is a vendor who sells fish in the busy local market of Battambang Province. She is married to Mr. Touch Moeung who owns a motorbike to operate a service around his community. Most of his clients are passengers who need him to take them to and from the market in order to buy something. Recently, Yim S.’s husband is concerned that his motorbike often breaks down and his income has been affected. Because of that, Mrs. Yim S. has requested a loan of $600 for her husband use to replace his old motorbike.

loans.use: To replace an old motorbike.

loans.name: Aniana

texts.en:
Aniana O. is married to a fisherman.  She is blessed with a daughter who is now 17 years old. Her only dream in life is for her daughter, who is now in her sophomore year in college, to finish her degree and then find a good job and improve her quality of life. 

Aniana joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (a partner of KIVA in the Philippines) to gain access to capital for her store, which she started 8 years ago. Her profits from this business help her to meet her family’s daily needs, especially the expenses incurred by her daughter in going to school. Now Aniana has decided to start selling rice, so she has applied for a loan of PHP 25,000 to buy 10 sacks of rice (at PHP 1,800 per sack), sacks of charcoal, and cases of soft drinks and liquor. She plans to develop her business into a full-fledged grocery store someday, and hopes that KIVA lenders will support her financially as she works to turn her plans and goals in life into realities.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, charcoal, soft drinks, and liquor

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es: El señor Francisco Javier Z.  C., tiene 48 años habitante del Barrio El Edén, es casado, y su mujer se dedica a vender frutas y verduras, tienen 3 hijos menores de edad, que se dedican a los estudios, el Sr. Z., es agricultor con más de 10 años de experiencia en los que ha batallado con los problemas de plagas, sequia y enfermedades, y es para sus terrenos que solicito un préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, insecticidas, que realicen un mantenimiento fitosanitario, a sus tierras para el aumento de la producción y por ende que  las vendas favorezcan a los proyectos familiares que se  tienen trazados, o la inversión a su negocio en beneficio de las condiciones de vida de todos sus hijos.
texts.en: Francisco Javier Z. C. is 48 years old and a resident of the El Edén neighborhood.  He is married and his wife sells fruit and vegetables.  They have 3 young children who are dedicated to their studies.  Mr. Z. is a farmer with more than 10 years of experience in which he has struggled with pest problems, drought, and diseases.  He is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer, fungicides, and insecticides.  He would like to maintain plant health on his lands to increase production so that the sales will help with the family projects that he has outlined or with the investment in his business to benefit the living conditions of all his children.

loans.use: Plant health maintenance on his lands

loans.name: May

texts.en: May O. is 29 years old and married to Alfie O., a fisherman. The couple are blessed with two children, aged 10 and 3. Her eldest is now a grade 5 pupil. For almost 8 years their primary source of income has been fishing. Their business is a partnership between husband and wife; he does the fishing while she sells the catch in the market. Profit from their business helps a lot in meeting their daily financial needs. However, they want to earn more and save for the future of their two children. They wish to provide them a better quality of living and send them to a prominent school. May is applying for a loan of PHP 25,000 to invest in setting up more fish cages. They will buy fish fingerlings, fishing nets, and bamboo poles, and pay for the labor of construction. She hopes that KIVA lenders will support her in this endeavor. She is one of the very dynamic members of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a partner of KIVA in the Philippines.

loans.use: to invest in setting up more fish cages

loans.name: Marcia Karen

texts.es: La señora Marcia Karen V. B. V. vive con su menor hija de seis años de edad su domicilio se encuentra ubicada en calle Mercaderes Ica. La solicitante requiere del crédito para ampliar su negocio ya que sueña con tener una tienda más completa como un minimarkert, presenta buenas referencias personales y laborales no tiene deuda con entidades bancarias por tal mótivo se  le otorgará el crédito y de esta manera assumirá una nueva responsabilidad.
texts.en: Marcia Karen V. B. V. lives with her young daughter who is six years old. Her home is located on Mercaderes Ica street. Marcia is requesting a loan to expand her business; now that she has a dream of having a more well stocked store, similar to a mini-mart. She has good personal and work references. She does not have any bank debt. Therefore, the loan will allow her to take on a new responsibility.

loans.use: work capital

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en: Oyungerel D. is 43 years old and lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her family live together in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent with a fence. Her son attends a local secondary school while her daughter attends university. Her husband is currently unemployed and Oyungerel operates a grocery store in her community. She began her business in 2007 with a small shop and now her working capital exceeds 1,500,000 tugriks (MNT). Over the years, she has been able to build a stable business. Her daily average income is between 120,000 and 150,000 MNT. Oyungerel wants to continue growing her business and increasing her product line by selling cell phone parts in the future. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more products

loans.name: Uranchimeg

texts.en: Uranchimeg T. is 54 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She lives with her family in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. All her children are grown up and are working on their own. Her husband is retired and usually goes between Ulaanbaatar and the countryside. Uranchimeg operates an eye glasses and gloves retail business from a stall at the local market. During cold months, she sells padding materials along with her other products. Uranchimeg started her business in 2000 with working capital of 300,000 tugriks (MNT) and has built a stable operation. Today, her working capital exceeds 600,000 – 700,000 MNT. She is a very polite and cheerful woman. Her dream is to expand her business and have her own small shop in the future. She is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more window padding materials that are used for winterization at wholesale prices to sell in the market as a retailer.

loans.use: To purchase more window padding materials

loans.name: Suom

texts.en: Mrs. Suom P. was born in 1959 and has established a small family in the best territory, Battambang Province, Cambodia. She is married with five children. Three of the children are employed and two are enrolled in school. Suom P. has another partner in her husband who has learned how to build houses and has been using his knowledge to earn a living. Mrs Suom P. is able to plant crops at least twice a year by following both rainy and dry seasons. The approaching rainy season is good for planting. Suom P. doesn’t have capital yet to use on her farm. So, Mrs. Suom P. is looking for a loan to purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting. (Mrs. Suom P.’s husband appears in the photo).

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, insecticides, and seeds for planting.

loans.name: Mehriddin

texts.en: Vegetable sales are a flourishing business in Tajikistan for the simple reason that every home needs vegetables. Mehriddin has been selling vegetables in Isfara city for the past seven years. He began his own stall with his hard-earned savings as he had always wanted to be an entrepreneur. Mehriddin began selling in Isfara market with very little stock to offer his clients. Slowly, he began to increase the goods offered until he managed to get a permanent market stall. Currently, his stall is his pride and joy with a zinc roof and ceramic tiles on the floor. Now Mehriddin needs a loan the size of 7000 Somoni in order to increase his stock. He promises to repay the loan without any violation and expresses his gratitude to everyone supporting him. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Increasing the range of vegetables

loans.name: Riyozat

texts.en: I. Riyozat is 47 years old and comes from a large and humble family. She is married and the loving mother of four children. Her father's hard and demanding character showed her, from the time she was a little girl, the significant value of work, and therefore she has been successful in various activities throughout her life. Now Riyozat dedicates herself to raising and selling cattle. With the income she generates, she provides a better quality of life for her family. Riyozat asks for a loan of 5000 somoni in order to buy more calves to sell when they are fully grown. With this investment she will be able to substantially increase her earnings and improve her quality of life. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase calves

loans.name: Mahmud

texts.en: Mahmud is married and has two children. For the last eight years, he has made a living running a grocery store that offers a large variety of foods. It's a great place to shop because customers can buy everything they need in one place. He also has good prices and discounts that help him to attract new clients and retain existing ones. Mahmud has applied for a loan to increase his inventory of items to sell. His goal is to continue to expand his business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing foodstuffs to increasing the range of goods for selling

loans.name: Rahmon

texts.en:
Rahmon is a businessman who successfully combines running his business and taking care of his family of three people. He has two children. Rahmon is originally from Isfara, a city in the south of Tajikistan. He started his business 15 years ago, after a desperate period of unemployment when his family didn’t get enough for their most basic needs. Today, he offers his services as a woodworker. Rahmon has a perfect credit history. He has already repaid one loan from IMON International without any delinquencies. This time, Rahmon is requesting a loan of $1200 USD to purchase wood products like bold timber, plank timber for his production. We believe this loan will also be repaid promptly. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of wood products like bold timber, plank timber for his production.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es: La señora Adela es la presidenta del grupo, tiene  41 años y vive en la zona R de Huaycan, está casada y tiene 5 hijos de los cuales aun tiene 3 a su cargo, vende frutas en el mercado desde hace 4 años, el mismo tiempo que lleva trabajando con Edaprospo, el cual le ah ayudado a mejorar su negocio y a comprar su stand de muebles, a ella le gustaría poner un minimarket y así ayudar a mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Su grupo se llama “Santa Rosa de Lima” porque se formo en agosto y está conformado por 7 amigas vecinas, ellos esperan alcanzar sus metas y que Edaprospo les brinde de capital para eso.En la foto las acompaña el hermano de la señora Adela.
texts.en:
Adela, 41, is group President.  She lives in the rural area of Huaycan.  She’s married and has five children of whom three are still in her care.  She has sold fruits in the market for the last 4 years, the same amount of time she’s collaborated with Edaprospo which has helped her improve her business and buy her stand. She would like to have a minimarket to improve her family’s quality of life.

Her group is called “Santa Rosa de Lima” because it was formed in August.  It has 7 members who are neighbors.  They hope to reach their goals and that Edaprospo will provide capital to do so.  Adela’s brother appears in the photo with them.

loans.use: To buy products and supplies.

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Marta tiene 43 años y ha sido la presidenta del grupo “Nueva Esperanza” conformado por 10 socias que llevan 10 años trabajando con Edaprospo, Ellas son amigas y vecinas. Marta es una criadora D. animales D. granja, además venD. sabanas, con estos ingresos y la ayuda D. su esposo pagan la Universidad D. su hija Sasha que estudia Ciencias D. la Comunicación, con el tiempo y la ayuda D. Edaprospo, espera poner su propia tienda para alimentos D. aves D. granja y para esto desea que Edaprospo aumente su capital.
texts.en: Marta is 43 years old and she is the president of the Nueva Esperanza group which consists of 10 members that have been working with EDAPROSPO for 10 years.  The group members are neighbors and friends.  Marta raises farm animals and also sells sheets.  With this income and with the help of her husband, they pay for her daughter, Sasha’s, university studies in communication.  With time and EDAPROSPO’s help, she hopes to set up her own store to sell poultry feed, which is why she is requesting the loan to increase her capital.

loans.use: To purchase products and supplies.

loans.name: Bayarmaa

texts.en: Bayarmaa S. lives with her five-year-old daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her daughter attends a local elementary school. Bayarmaa worked as a seamstress and quality control specialist in a tailoring factory from 2000 to 2005. She operated her sewing business in 2005 by making and repairing a variety of clothing items in a rented space at Urt Tsagaan Street, a central and crowded area of Ulaanbaatar. Between 2007 and 2009, she worked as a seamstress in the Czech Republic and restarted her sewing business in 2010. Recently she was able to enlarge her workplace. She needs more funds to purchase necessary tools and equipment and to renovate her workplace. Therefore, she is requesting a 1,100,000 MNT loan.

loans.use: To purchase necessary tools and equipment

loans.name: Hydee

texts.en:
Haydee T., 27 years old, is from the gemstone capital of Antique (Sibalom). She is living with Albert Esler, a construction worker and a very supportive partner. They are not yet married though they have two children. Their oldest child is already four years old and the youngest is one year old.

She has been active member of ASHI Antique South East Branch since 2008. At a very young age, she dreamed of having a stable business in order to sustain their basic needs and to improve their living conditions through the help of ASHI. 

As of now, she is applying for her third loan of PHP 12,000. This amount will be used as additional working capital for her business, which is “Lapida Making” (Engraved Marble). The word “lapida” means a permanent indicator placed over or next to the site of burial. It is also a symbol of respect and recognition of the dead. It is in the lapida that the name, age, birthdate and death date can be found.

They chose this business because they believe that they will earn more income from this, especially since the all souls day is approaching. Also, it could provide employment to their neighbors and relatives.

She wants all of their children to finish college, earning a degree so that they will not experience again the nightmares of poverty.

loans.use: As working capital

loans.name: Ganchuluun

texts.en: Ganchuluun T., 31 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live together in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Both his children attend a local kindergarten while his wife works as a private businesswoman. He operates an accessories retail sales business in a stall in Bayanzurh, an indoor market, in Ulaanbaatar. He started his business in 2007 by selling a variety of pendants and accessories made of stone. His daily profit is between 60,000 and 100,000 MNT. Ganchuluun imports his products from Beijing and Shanghai, China's two biggest cities. Over the years, he has built a stable and successful operation and has gained much experience as a businessman. He wants to expand his business and open another stall where he will sell a variety of stationary. He is requesting a 2,700,000 MNT in order to increase his working capital.

loans.use: to increase working capital

loans.name: Munh-Ochir

texts.en: Munh-Ochir S. is 49 years old and lives with his wife and four sons in Hovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. The elder two sons attend university, his middle son currently serves in the Mongolian military force and his youngest son attends a local secondary school. He has been driving for the past 10 years and started his transportation service based on his many years of experience. His wife has operated a meat trading business since 1995 in the local market. Munh-Ochir is a very resourceful and quick man. He is requesting a 600,000 MNT loan to purchase livestock at wholesale prices for his wife's meat trading business.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corn seeds to cultivate.

loans.name: Narantsetseg

texts.en: Narantsetseg T. is 44 years old and lives with her two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She and her two children live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic dwelling tent, in a rented yard. Her daughter attends university while her son attends primary school. Narantsetseg has been operating a business producing dumplings since June 2009 and has built a stable business. She makes her dumplings from intestines and sells her products by visiting shops and stores. Her earnings are the only source of her family's income and provide for her household's needs. In the future, she is planning to make dumplings with meat. She is a very honest and modest woman and is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase a meat grinder in order to produce meat dumplings.

loans.use: To purchase a meat grinder

loans.name: María Adela

texts.es: María Adela M. D. M. D. 40 años D. edad, resiD. en Tonacatepeque, en donD. vive junto a su esposo quien es empleado D. una empresa privada y junto a sus tres hijos D. 20, 14 y 6 años D. edad, quienes se dedican a estudiar.  María posee una venta D. ropa para mujeres y hombre, la cual comercializa a las afueras del mercado municipal D. Tonacatepeque, así mismo venD. huevos D. codorniz, los cuales se venden a muy buen precio debido a que son muy poco comunes en esta zona. María solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda adquirir mayor cantidad D. ropa, lo que le permita atender a más clientes y ofrecer una mayor variedad D. productos, así mismo posee muchos clientes los cuales llegan a su negocio con el único fin D. obtener huevos D. codorniz, por lo que desea comprar mayor cantidad D. estos para suplir la necesidad D. sus clientes. D. esta manera María podrá obtener mayores ingresos los cuales son muy necesarios para la estabilidad D. su hogar.
texts.en:
María Adela M. D. M., 40, lives in Tonacatepeque with her husband who is employed by a private firm and their three children who are 20, 14 and 6 years of age and in school.

María sells clothing for women and men outsiD. the Tonacatepeque Municipal Market.  She also sells quail eggs at a very good price because they aren’t very common in this area.

María is asking for funds to buy larger quantities of clothes so that she can tend to more customers and offer a greater variety of products.  She has many customers who come by her business with the only end in mind to buy quail eggs so she also wants to increase her stock of these items to meet customer demand.

María hopes thus to earn higher income that is very necessary for her home’s stability.

loans.use: To buy clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic grains and spices.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials for bread manufacture.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia R. D. M. D. 56 años D. edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, quien vive únicamente junto a su esposo, quien trabaja como obrero construyendo calles. Virginia resiD. en el municipio D. Ilopango, en donD. posee un pequeño bazar en el cual comercializa productos varios como: ropa para mujeres, zapatos, cacerolas, tazas, libros y accesorios para regalo. DesD. hace muchos años que ella trabaja en su bazar, surtiéndolo poco a poco, por lo que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir el negocio, comprando mayor cantidad D. ropa y zapatos, los cuales son los que más comercializa en el lugar. Así mismo Virginia desea comprar algunos juguetes debido a que se acerca la celebración del día del niño, fecha en la que sus ventas se incrementas. D. esta forma Virginia desea salir adelanta y D. esta forma contar con una vida mejor para ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
Virginia R. D. M., 56, is a very hard working person.  She lives only with her husband who works as a laborer building streets.  Virginia lives in Ilopango where she has a small store where she sells such things as: women’s clothing, shoes, pots, cups, books and gift wrapping supplies.  

She has worked in her store for several years stocking it little by little.  This is why she is asking for funding in order to stock the business buying a greater amount of clothing and shoes which are the items that sell best.  

Virginia also wants to buy some toys because the feast day dedicated to children is approaching and sales increase then.  Virginia hopes thus to get ahead and have a better life for herself and her husband.

loans.use: To buy clothes, shoes and household items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase raw materials for food.

loans.name: Cruz Seisy

texts.es: Cruz Seisy F. D. A. D. 61 años D. edad, se dedica a la venta D. platillos típicos tales como: yuca frita, tamales D. elote, pupusas y otros más. Así mismo cada mediodía ella elabora tortillas las cuales comercializa con sus vecinos. La señora Cruz vive junto a su esposo y tres hijos quienes se dedican a estudiar. Debido a que la casa D. cruz, lugar en el cual se encuentra su negocio, está cerca del Instituto Salvadores D. Seguro Social D. la colonia Atlacatl, ella posee muy buenas ventas ya que cada tarD. muchos D. los empleados y pacientes D. dicho hospital consumen D. los platillos típicos que ella elabora, lo que incentiva a Cruz a seguir adelante con sus ventas. Es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar: arroz, frijoles, maíz, algunas verduras y otros productos más, así mismo desea comprar cilindros D. gas propano para contar con una pequeña provisión.
texts.en: Cruz Seisy F. D. A. is 61 years old and sells traditional dishes such as fried yucca, corn tamales, pupusas (flatbread stuffed with meat, cheese, or vegetables) and more.  She also makes tortillas at midday which she sells to her neighbors.  Sra. Cruz lives with her husband and three children who are in school.  Because her home, which is also the place her business is located, is close to the Institute of Social Security of the Atlacatl colony, she has very good sales and every evening many of the employees and patients in the hospital consume the traditional dishes that she makes, which incentivizes Cruz to continue pursuing her sales.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, corn, some vegetables, and other products.  She also wants to buy propane gas cylinders to have a small supply available.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for food preparation.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy perishable items.

loans.name: Rossana Regina

texts.es: Rossana Regina M. A. de 40 años de edad, es una persona la cual se destaca por ser muy trabajadora y emprendedora, quien siempre cuenta con el deseo de mejorar cada día más. Ella reside en el municipio de Soyapango, el cual está ubicado en el departamento de San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo, y junto a sus dos hijos de 10 y 12  años de edad quienes se dedican a estudiar. Rossana posee su propia tienda de productos perecederos como: golosinas, sodas, jugos, leche, pan, granos básicos y otros más, el negocio se encuentra en su casa de habitación, lo cual es de mucho beneficio para ella debido a que le permite cuidar de sus hijos al mismo tiempo que atiende su tienda. A pesar que cuenta con mucha competencia, posee varios clientes los cuales a diario consumen de sus productos. Rossana solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para surtir la tienda, comprando productos por mayor, de manera que cuente con todo lo necesario para atender de la mejor manera a sus clientes y así obtener algunos nuevos. Rossana desea mucho poder aumentar sus ventas y de esta forma vivir mejor junto a su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
Rossana Regina M. A., 40, is a person who stands out for being very hard working and enterprising.  She wants to improve daily. She lives in Soyapango, San Salvador department, with her husband and two children who are 10 and 12 years of age and in school.  

Rossana has a small grocery store.  She stocks such items as: snacks, soft drinks, juices, milk, bread and basic grains, among others.  The store is located in her home which is very beneficial for her because she can watch after her children while tending to her store.

Despite facing much competition she has several regular customers that come by daily to buy from her.  Rossana is asking for a loan to stock her store buying products at wholesale so that she can meet customer needs and attract new customers.  She very much wants to increase sales so that she can live better alongside her small family.

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy perishables

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena D. is 64 years old and married with two children. Her eldest son is a graduate of Marine Engineering while her daughter finished high school. Elena is an active member of Ahon sa HIrap, Inc. (ASHI) – MFI partner of KIVA in the Philippines. Elena's prime sources of income are her variety store and her business of buying and selling sandals, slippers, barbecue sticks and charcoal. After almost 3 years of operating these businesses, her income is good and can provide for the family's daily needs.

Elena is applying for a new loan to provide additional capital for her buying and selling business and variety store. She will buy barbecue sticks (sticks made of bamboo), more slippers, and sacks of charcoal to sell and display in her store. She will also use part of the loan to buy additional grocery products for her store. She hopes that she can continue earning profits so that she can provide for the family's daily needs. Her dream is to live in a nice house and have stable income.

loans.use: to buy slippers, charcoal, barbecue sticks and grocery products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase foodstuffs and household goods.

loans.name: Concepción

texts.es: Concepción C. F. de de 51 años de edad, reside en el departamento de Usulután, en donde vive junto a sus 7 nietos todos menores de edad, y  los cuales están al cuidado total de Concepción. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, la cual se esfuerza a diario por sacar a sus nietos adelante y así mismo brindarles estudio, alimentos y todo lo que necesitan. Concepción comercializa queso, cuajada y crema, la cual vende en la terminal de Usulután, en donde posee muchos clientes que laboran en el lugar y así mismo con personas que llegan de otros lugares del país. Concepción solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar los productos lácteos por mayor y de esta forma ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos. Las ganancias generadas por este negocio son de mucha importancia para Concepción debido a que son la única fuente de ingresos con la que sale adelante con su familia.
texts.en: Concepción C. F., who is 51 years old, lives in Usulután Department with her 7 dependent grandchildren who are looked after solely by her.  She is a very hardworking and enterprising person who puts forth the effort every day to improve her grandchildren's quality of life and to give them schooling, food and everything they need.  Concepción sells cheese, curd and cream in the Usulután bus station where she has a lot of customers, both people who work there as well as people who have traveled from other areas of the country.  Concepción is requesting a loan with which she will be able to purchase wholesale dairy products.  She will then be able to offer a larger quantity of products for sale.  The profits generated by this business are very important for Concepción because are the only source of income with which she and her family can get ahead.

loans.use: To purchase dairy products to commercialize.

loans.name: César Obdulio

texts.es: César Obdulio O. P. de 31 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa la cual se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar, así mismo vive junto a su pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad, y también con su madre la cual colabora cuidando a su nieto.  César trabaja en su propio taller automotriz en el cual se dedica a la reparación de automóviles, así mismo realiza revisiones periódicas a los automóviles de diferentes clientes. Con el fin de obtener algunas ganancias extras, César también comercializa diferentes repuestos y accesorios para el mantenimiento optimo de los carros. César solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero  necesario por medio del cual pueda comprar todos las herramientas necesarias para la realización de su trabajo y así mismo para comprar más repuestos. César es un padre de familia muy responsable, quien siempre se esfuerza por darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
César Obdulio O. P. is 31 years old and lives with his wife, who does the household chores. He also lives with his young 4-year-old son and with his mother, who helps to take care of her grandson. César works at his mechanic shop where he repairs cars and does periodic car inspections for different customers. To earn some extra money, César also sells different spare parts and accessories for good car maintenance.

César is requesting a loan so that he will have the money to purchase all of the necessary tools to do his work, as well as to buy more spare parts. César is a very responsible father and he always works hard to provide the best for his family.

loans.use: To purchase spare auto parts.

location.town: San Juan Opico, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Teresa Esperanza

texts.es: Teresa Esperanza L. D. R. D. 57 años D. edad, resiD. en el departamento D. San Salvador, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposo quien trabaja como taxista. Ambos son personas muy trabajadoras, quienes se esfuerzan día con día para vivir D. una forma digna. Teresa cuenta con un chalet, en el cual elabora diferentes tipos D. comida rápida como: hamburguesas, hotdog, papas fritas, y así mismo platillos típicos como pupusas y otros más. El negocio está ubicado en las cercanías del estadio Cuscatlán, el estadio más granD. del país, el cual es un lugar D. mucho comercio y afluencia D. personas por lo que ella cuenta con varios clientes. Teresa solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar toda la materia prima para la elaboración D. la comida como: carne, salchichas, salsas y otras más.
texts.en:
Teresa Esperanza L. D. R. is 57 years old and lives in the department of San Salvador with her husband who works as a taxi driver. She and her husband are both very hardworking people and put in effort everyday to live a decent life.

Teresa has a place where she sells different types of fast food such as hamburgers, hotdogs, French fries, as well as traditional dishes such as pupusas and others. Her business is located near the Cuscatlán stadium, which is the country’s biggest and is a place with a lot of business and people that pass by, meaning many customers for her.

Teresa is requesting a loan so that she can purchase materials for making the food such as: meat, hot dogs, sauces, and other items.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for making food.

loans.name: Solongo

texts.en: Solongo D. is 35 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her family lives together in their own ger, a traditional Mongolian housing tent. Her elder two sons attend a secondary school, while her infant son stays at home. Her husband helps out with the business and also works as an electrician to supplement the family's income. Solongo operates a grocery shop with the help of her mother and husband. She sells a variety of foodstuffs through her grocery shop. Solongo has been in this business since 2005 and has built a stable operation. For the future, Solongo hopes to continue to expand her business and save money in order to obtain assets for her children. She is very hardworking. She is requesting a 3,000,000 tugrik (MNT) loan to purchase more supplies and food items for her store in order to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To purchase more supplies and food items

loans.name: Estela Maribel

texts.es: Estela Maribel R. D. P., madre soltera D. dos hijos D. 10 y 12 años D. edad, resiD. en Soyapango, ubicado en el departamento D. San Salvador. Ella posee una tortillería la cual está ubicada en el mercado D. la colonia El Matazano ubicado en el mismo municipio D. Soyapango. Ella cuenta con 6 años D. contar con este negocio el cual le permite brindarles todo lo necesario a sus dos pequeños hijos los cuales son la prioridad en su vida. Con el deseo D. poder brindarles una vida mejor a sus pequeños, Estela solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar una nueva cocina para hacer las tortillas, así mismo comprar cilindros D. gas propano y también comprar maíz y frijol por mayor. Estela desea salir adelante y D. esta forma contar con una vida mejor para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
Estela Maribel R. D. P. is a single mother of two children who are 10 and 12 years old. She lives in Soyapango, located in the department of San Salvador. Estela has a tortilla stand in the El Matazano market which is located in the municipality of Soyapango. She has been in this business for six years and it allows her to proviD. everything necessary to her two small children who are her priority.

With the desire to be able to proviD. her children with a better life, Estela is requesting a loan so that she can buy a new cooker to make the tortillas, as well as propane gas tanks and wholesale corn and beans. Estela wants to get ahead and this way, have a better life for herself and her family.

loans.use: To purchase corn and beans.

loans.name: Sulima

texts.en:
Sulima D. C. joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc., (ASHI), a partner MFI (microfinance institution) of Kiva in the Philippines, in the year 2005. She is one of the reputable members of ASHI in her town. She is married to Nestor, who is a fisherman and sometimes a driver. They have three children: a 29-year-old construction worker, a 21-year-old factory worker and a 16-year-old high school student. 

The main source of their family income is fishing and a secondary source comes from selling barbecue sticks. She is applying for a loan of 20,000 Philippine pesos to finance construction of a pump boat that her husband will use in his fishing activity. They will buy materials and a new motor to complete the building of the boat. 

Her business plan after this loan is to invest capital in putting up fish cages to increase the fish catch. She hopes that Kiva friends will continue their financial support to her for the benefit of her family and grandchildren.

loans.use: To buy materials and a motor for the construction of a pump boat

loans.name: Zorigt

texts.en: Zorigt K. is 32 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Hovd province in Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent in a rented yard. His oldest son, 8, attends a local secondary school and his youngest daughter, 5, attends a local kindergarten. His wife is currently unemployed and stays at home. Zorigt operates a taxi service in his local town. He began his taxi business in 2006 and has gained a lot of experience since then. In addition, he runs a car repair service center with help of his brother to supplement his family's income. He is a very modest and hardworking man and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan in order to improve the car he uses as a taxi.

loans.use: To improve his car

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
At age 45, Corazon D. S. is a tough and determined widow who has the responsibility of taking care of their three children. Her eldest is 21, the middle one is 19 and the youngest is 17 years old. All her children finished only high school because she does not have the capacity to send them to college because of the expensive fares required to going in and out of the island where they live. Some of her children already have a family of their own. 

She joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) a partner MFI of KIVA in the Philippines. As a member, she makes sure that her loans are invested properly and she performs her duties and responsibilities diligently. For almost five years she has been buying and selling dried fish. Aside from the fish caught by her children, she will buy fresh fish from the fishermen and dry them. She will then pack the fish in kilos and sell them to the market and to her frequent customers. She is applying for a loan of PHP 25,000 for additional capital for her dried fish business and to finance the plan of her eldest son to put up a locally known fish trap called "skylab" that is made up of fish net and bamboo poles positioned in the allowed fishing area of the lake. Income generated from this business will be used to renovate their house and for the daily consumption of her children and grandchildren. She is hoping that KIVA lenders will help them in this venture.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish and finance construction of a fish trap

loans.name: Afaddin

texts.ru:
Afaddin G. 24 qoda. On ne jenat i jivet v Absheron regione. Afaddin uje 3 qoda kak rabotayet myasnikom. Etomu biznesu on nauchilsya u svoyeqo otca on toje yavlyayetsya myasnikom, po yeqo sovetu Afaddin i nachal etot biznes.

Seychas Afaddin nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit xolodilnik dlya xraneniya myaso. U neqo bil xolodilnik no on isportilsya. Teper on nujdayetsya v novom xolodilnike dlya dalneysheqo razviyita svoyeqo biznesa.
texts.en:
Afaddin G. is 24 years old.  He is single and lives in the Absheron region.   Afaddin has been working as a butcher for three years.  With his father (who is also a butcher) advising him, he started his own business. 

Now, Affaddin needs 2000 AZN to buy a refrigerator to store meat.  He had a refrigerator, but it broke.  Now, he needs a new refrigerator to further develop his business.

loans.use: Buying a refrigerator to store meat

loans.name: Twidike Group

texts.en:
Elizabeth R., who is in her early 40s, is married with five children. She has a table in the market where she sells fruits and vegetables. She uses the other side of the table to sell rice, sugar and beans. She started this business five years ago and works daily from 8am until 10pm. She is able to earn a fair monthly profit. 

This will be Elizabeth’s second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase stock for her business and has repaid the loan successfully. She now hopes for a second loan to buy more stock of the same products. 
	
Elizabeth will share this loan with her loan group, Twidike, which totals 19 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. 

In the picture, Elizabeth is standing at the far left in a white shirt.

loans.use: To increase her business stock

loans.name: Dulce

texts.en: Married to a fisherman and mother of two children, Dulce R. often dreamed of a better and quality standard of living. Both husband and wife are full of determination to save for the future of their 8 and 7 year old children. When she heard of Ahon sa HIrap, Inc. (ASHI), a partner MFI of KIVA in the Philippines, she immediately joined to have access to capital. With her previous loan, she bought additional fishing gear for her husband. She engages in fish vending. The income generated from their fish selling business helps in providing for their financial needs. The partnership of this couple works great so, again, she is applying for another loan worth PHP 25,000.00 pesos. She will use the funds from this loan for the construction of fish cages that her husband will maintain. They will buy materials such as fish nets, bamboo poles, and pay the labor costs for the assembly of fish cages and fingerlings to be place inside the cage. With the implementation of this plan, They will generate more profit and increase their income after only 3 months. She is hoping that KIVA lenders will continue to support in their business plan and support their dreams in life.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishcages.

loans.name: Fadail

texts.ru:
Fadail G. 22 qoda. On ne jenat. Fadail yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda i seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste s semyoy. 

Fadail uje 2 qoda kak otkril kafe . Etomu biznessu yeqo nauchil dyadya i on pomoq yemu otkrit eto kafe. Seychas Fadail nujdayetsya  v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit stoli i stulya dlya svoyeqo kafe.
texts.en:
Fadail G. is 22 years old.  He is single.  Fadail is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from the city of Fuzuli who now lives in the Fuzuli region with his family.

Fadail opened a café two years ago.  He started the business with his uncle who helped him open the café.  Now, Fadail needs 2000 AZN to buy tables and chairs for the café.

loans.use: kupit stoli,stulya dlya svoyeqo kafe

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en: Mirasol A., 37 years old, is married to a fisherman and lives on an island located in the middle of Laguna de Bay in the Philippines. The couple is blessed with two 2 children: an 11year old boy and 9 year old girl, who are both studying. She joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. a partner MFI of KIVA to have access on capital for starting a business. Since the lake is abundant with fish, and their main source of income is fishing, they decided to avail of loans to fund their fish vending business. She is applying for a new loan amounting PHP 20,000.00 to finance assembly of a fish trap, locally know as “skylab”, and a fish cage. She will buy materials for the construction and fingerlings to be place in the fish cage. She is optimistic that their profit will increase from this investment. She is hopeful that KIVA lenders will support her in their business plan.

loans.use: To buy materials for the assembly of fish cage and a fish trap locally known as "skylab".

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina N. is 37 years old and lives in the town of Nasana, in the Kampala east region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children. Madina has a business of a salon, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Madina has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase oil treatment for hair and braids. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Madina hopes to generate greater profits and to buy food. In the future, Madina hopes to own a house.

loans.use: To buy more oil treatment for the hair and braids.

loans.name: Aitbubu

texts.en:
Aitbubu J. is a 63 year old farmer, who lives in the high-mountain Ak-Tala region in Kyrgyzstan. She is married and has six children. Her family has been engaged in cattle breeding for the past 17 years, which is the only mean of subsistence for them. Today Aitbubu has five cows, four goats, one horse and fourteen sheep. To reduce expenses for the livestock's foraging, she pastures her livestock in the mountainous areas with native grasses. Also, Aitbubu is engaged in cultivating wheat and holy clover, part of which she sells to the local customers. With the revenues from these activities, Aitbubu managed to marry her two sons and give good dowries to her three daughters. 

Now Aitbubu is applying for a loan of 20,000 KGS to buy bull-calves. With the revenues, she plans to broaden her business by means of breeding. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Novena

texts.en: Novena T., 34, is married to a very industrious man by the name of Almario T.. He is 36 years old, a fisherman and at the same time fish vendor. He can also drive a boat. The couple has 5 children, the eldest is 13 years old and the youngest is 4 years old. Their primary source of income is selling fresh and dried fish wherein both husband and wife are involved. She is applying for a new loan of PHP 20,000.00 pesos to buy bulk fresh fish to be delivered in their town market or even nearby municipalities. She hopes to earn more profits so that she can provide the financial necessities of her children, particularly in their schooling. She joins Ahon sa HIrap, Inc. (ASHI), a partner MFI of KIVA, in the Philippines because she wanted to provide a better standard of living for her family. As a member, she properly utilized all her loans to earn profits for their future. She is praying that many KIVA lenders will support her in all her future business plans like having their own motorized boat for the convenience of delivering their products from the island to the market and establishing a fish stall in their town market.

loans.use: To buy bulk fresh fish for selling.

loans.name: Gulzamira

texts.en:
Gulzamira J. is 38 years old. She lives in Koprobazar village in the north-west of Kyrgyzstan and has five school-aged children. Gulzamira worked as a milker at the local state farm and is described as a benevolent, responsible and very hardworking woman.

In 1995, Gulzamira began to develop their business, with her husband, of stock-breeding and bought two cows using their initial capital of 20,000 KGS. Also, Gulzamira began to cultivate land with potatoes and perennial herbs. The children help their parents in these activities and take part in making the family business.  

Gulzamira intends to use this loan of 60,000 KGS to buy one cow and ten sheep for fattening and reselling. With the revenues, she plans to build a barn for appropriate maintenance of her livestock. 

In the future, Gulzamira wants to buy a small truck for transportation of milk and meat products to customers in different regions. 
Bai-Tushum and Partners use Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Rossana

texts.en: Rosanna D., 54 years old, is a very dynamic and hard working mother of 3 children. She is married to Librado D. who works as crew of a passenger boat that travels from the island where they live to the mainland. This small island is situated in the middle of Laguna de Bay in the Philippines. They were not able to send their children to college. Their main source of income is fishing, in which her two sons are active. They also make barbeque sticks out of bamboo and invest in hog fattening. She is a member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.(ASHI), a partner MFI of KIVA since 2008. She is applying for a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy materials for the repair of their boat and to finance the assembly of a new fish cage. She is hoping to earn more profits from this investment so that she can fulfill her dream of building a better house and provide education to her only daughter. She prays that more KIVA friends will support her goals and plans.

loans.use: To repair boat and assemble a fish cage.

loans.name: Jumabubu

texts.en:
Jumabubu E. is 54 years old. She lives in Emgekchil village in the north of Kyrgyzstan and has seven children. 
Jumabubu has a higher pedagogical education, and worked as a primary school teacher at a local area for 35 years. She is characterized by her colleagues as a responsible, precise and open-hearted person. Now she is on pension and is engaged in cattle breeding.  

Jumabubu used her starting capital of 10,000 KGS to buy livestock for fattening and reselling. Thanks to her persistent and hard-working personality, she managed to enlarge the number of her livestock to five sheep, five goats, two cows and one horse. She sells milk to her customers at the local market and earns about 3,000 KGS monthly. With the revenues from livestock reselling, Jumabubu was able to  build up a barn and renovate her house. 

Jumabubu plans to use this loan of 60,000 KGS to buy three calves and fifteen sheep. With the revenues from the loan, she plans to broaden out her business. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Micro-finance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of micro-finance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Uulbu

texts.en:
Uulbu S. is the single mother of one son. She lives in the Kyrgyz southern city Osh. Uulbu graduated from trade college and worked as a cashier in a local branch of a bank. The breakdown of the Soviet Union pulled down many lives, and as many other people did, Uulbu lost her job. But being a very optimistic person, she considered it as a chance to start a new life. 

With the sum of 10,000 Kyrgyz soms (KGS), Uulbu began her business of selling linen and belts. She worked hard and managed to buy a flat for her small family. In order to enlarge the assortment of goods, in 2008, Uulbu obtained her first loan of 80,000 KGS from Bai Tushum and Partners. This loan was used as intended and repaid without any delays. 

Her activity started to bring permanent profit and the number of customers increased. This fact lead Uulbu to take her second loan from Bai Tushum and Partners, which was also used to enlarge her business.

But in June 2010, when violent clashes caused by a deposed political regime broke out in the city of Osh, Uulbu lost her business, which was robbed and looted. But Uulbu, being an optimistic and hardworking person, didn’t give up and decided to resume her lost business and continue activities. 

For this very reason, Uulbu is applying for a loan of 135,000 KGS, which she needs to restart her business. Despite the many difficulties along the way, Uulbu doesn’t look back and is ready to take a step forward to her future.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase goods for reselling.

loans.name: Ibraim

texts.en:
Ibraim K. is a 58 year-old widower with five grown children. He lives in Altymish village. After graduating from the Institute of physical culture and sport, Ibraim devoted his life to the education of children. He worked at the local school for 35 years as a trainer and became school Head-deputy. Ibraim lived with a very happy marriage and his wife was the main person on whom he could rely. Last year, he lost his support. His beloved wife died and only his children and grandchildren could bring him back to life. Today, Ibraim lives with his youngest son, who followed Ibraim’s footsteps and became a teacher in the local school.  

In order to find an additional means of subsistence and to help his son to cover the expenses of his family with little children, Ibraim started to breed livestock. His hardworking and persistent activities carry him forward. Today he has two milk cows, one bull calf, and one mare with a foal. Now Ibraim wants to take a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy one milk cow and forage for his cattle. With the revenues from this investment, Ibraim plans to develop his farm by means of livestock breeding.

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Nazila

texts.ru:
Nazila A. 49 let. Ona zamujem i imeyet 3 detey. Nazila yavlyayetsya IDP personom ona pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione. 

Nazila uje 5 let kak zanimayetsya etim biznessom skotovodstva. Etomu biznessu ona nauchilas u svoyey mami. Nazila derjit korov i prodayet ix moloko i delayet sir. Seychas ona nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit korovu  dlya uvelicheniya kolichestva produkta.
texts.en:
Nazila A. is 49 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Nazila is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  She is a refugee from the city of Fuzuli who now lives in the Fuzuli region.

Nazila has been working as a cowherd for five years.  She started this business with her mother.  Nazila keeps cows, sells their milk, and makes cheese.  Currently, she need 2000 AZN to buy a cow which will enhance the quality of her product.

loans.use: Buying a cow

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros M. is 51 years old and the mother of four children. Her two eldest children are both working in a factory. There are two more relatives who she employed as vendors of her business who live with them. She is one of the oldest members of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), a partner MFI of KIVA in the Philippines, in their place. She is a very lively and dependent mother. She is engaged in buying and selling ready to wear clothes, fruits and vegetables. Her income in this business meets their daily financial needs and supports the schooling of her two youngest children. She plans to expand her business to generate more income so that she can start renovation of their house. She is applying for a loan of PHP 29,000 to buy more ready to wear products, fruits and vegetables. She hopes that ASHI and KIVA will again support her in this venture.

loans.use: to buy more RTW clothing, fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn V. is 35 years old and the mother of two children. In 2008, she joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.(ASHI), a partner MFI of KIVA in the Philippines. She is excited as she recalls all her experiences as a mother and a member of ASHI. Before joining ASHI, she remembers how hard it was to start a business, especially without having access to capital. Her prayer was granted when she became a member of the institution and started taking loans. She started earning and can regularly provide their basic needs. She is applying again for a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy additional grocery items, soft drinks and raw products for her food vending business. She wishes to expand her food vending business because she notices the increase of customers eating in her place. She plans to establish a more convenient place for her customers to eat and add more menus for them to choose from. She is hoping that KIVA lenders will support her future plans.

loans.use: To buy raw products for her food vending business and additional grocery items for her store

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina B. is 39 years old and the mother of three children. She has a very united family, where many cultures are combined, because Irina is Russian and her husband is Kazakh. They bring up their children in deep respect for the multicultural society of different nations in Kyrgyzstan.  

Irina graduated from food industrial college and got married at the age of 21. When she gave birth to her children, she became the main householder for the family. At that time, Irina’s husband worked as an engineer at the local dairy factory, but his wage was low and didn’t meet all expenses. That’s why Irina decided to start her business in trade and opened up a small shop near her house. Her activity started to bring in permanent profit, but unfortunately was not enough to cover expenses of her growing children. Being a very active person, Irina decided to engage in breeding cattle in the year 2000. She bought one cow and one bull calf and soon managed to multiply their number to five bull calves and one milk cow. With the revenue from this business, Irina was able to pay for the education of her elder son. 

Irina wants to take a loan of 120,000 KGS to buy bull calves for fattening and reselling. With the rest of the loan, she plans to expand the range of products in her shop. She hopes that this will help her increase revenue and let her open up a big shop in the future. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: With God All Things Are Possible Group

texts.en:
Sonnie J., who is holding the sign, is the leader of this group of five borrowers called With God All Things Are Possible. She is 40 years old, married and has four children aged between 10 and 21. She was only able to attend school to 5th grade due to lack of financial support.

For 17 years, she has been selling goods such as hinges, door locks, nails, knives, machetes and hacksaws in Redlight Market on the outskirts of Monrovia, Liberia. She plans to use her 14,000 Liberian Dollars portion of this 62,000 Liberian Dollars group loan to buy more stock. 

She describes herself as a very quiet woman whose dream is to improve her business and build a house.

In the photo that accompanies this profile, Marie is inset at lower right because she was absent during disbursal.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of stock such as hinges, door locks, nails, knives, machetes and hacksaws

loans.name: Jacques

texts.en: Jacques is 26 years old. He is married with two children aged 1 month and 2 years. He sells bananas. His wife is a farmer. He says that his business is well known for selling bananas at competitive prices and, also, he pays his taxes on time. Jacques has spent 15 years in this business and when he gets a loan he will buy more bananas to keep the business going. With the profit he will repair his house.

loans.use: to buy more bananas

loans.name: Childekan

texts.en:
Childekan A. is a 47-year-old widow with two children. She married in 1982 and had an excellent example of a close-knit family. Unfortunately, in 2006 her husband died of cancer and Childekan became the only bread-winner for her children. It was a very hard blow for the family, however, Childekan braced herself to make her children’s lives stable.
 
For many people in rural areas, cattle breeding is the main means of subsistence. Childekan took on this activity, which had been started by her late husband. Her success was achieved due to hard work and strong efforts. Childekan managed to increase the number of cattle but had to sell them in order to pay for her children's education. In their own way, her son and daughter do their best to help Childekan in the household. 

Now Childekan is applying for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase one horse, sheep and bull calves for fattening and reselling. With the revenue from the loan, she plans to pay for the next year of her children's edcuation. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Davaasuren

texts.en:
Davaasuren A. is 60 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two children work as salespeople in private shops while his son works in a construction company. His wife is disabled and currently stays at home. 

Davaasuren operates a raw material trading business in the local community. He purchases a variety of plastic bags to sell at market price for a profit.  He started this business in 2000 and, since then, has slowly grown his business. Davaasuren has gained much experience and knowledge over the years. His earnings have enabled him to provide for the household's needs. He hopes to buy his own house where he will live with his family. 

Davaasuren seems to be a very hardworking and modest man. He is requesting a 750,000 MNT loan to purchase more raw materials to increase sales and build his own workplace.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Enhbayar

texts.en:
Enhbayar T. is 60 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the Hentiy province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent, in a rented yard. His wife is currently unemployed while his three children attend local school. 

Enhbayar operates a transportation service in his town. He has been driving a taxi using his own Russian Jeep since 1993. He started transporting livestock using a big van. Over the years, he has gained a lot of experience as a driver and has achieved a stable level of operation. For the future, Enhbayar hopes to continue making progress with his business and says, "I am working hard in order to buy a new house and fence for my family". He is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to purchase one more engine which will be used as a replacement for his van.

loans.use: To purchase one more engine

loans.name: Gansuh

texts.en:
Gansuh J. is 50 years old and lives with his wife and two adult sons in Hentiy province in Mongolia. Both of his sons are students. His wife has worked as a bookkeeper in the Huvch Jonon Co. Ltd. for five years and receives a monthly salary of 200,000 MNT. 

Gansuh has been driving a taxi since 2006 and has built a stable and successful operation. Over the years, he has gained not only experience but also many permanent customers. In the evening and morning, he provides a call taxi service within the town. 

He eventually earned enough money to trade in his old vehicle for a newer and more convenient car for 6,500,000 MNT. Also, his business earnings have enabled him to pay his children's tuition fees. 

Gansuh is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase two new tires and to repair his car's engine.

loans.use: Two new tires and engine repair

loans.name: Gantogoo

texts.en:
Gantogoo D. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and five children in Hentiy province in Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. 

Both of her elder sons, ages 23 and 21, are students, and her younger three children all attend the local high school. Her husband is a herder and they own 200 head of livestock. 

Gantogoo operates a sewing business with the help of her siblings. She has been engaged in this business for the past five years and has gained much business experience as well as many permanent customers. She usually produces large sized items such as ger covers and ceilings, curtains and layers of felt. She also creates a variety of traditional clothes according to her customers' orders. 

In the future, she wants to have her own workplace. Her earnings have enabled her to pay her children's tuition fees. She is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to purchase an electronic sewing machine for her business.

loans.use: To purchase an electronic sewing machine

loans.name: Herlentsetseg

texts.en:
Herlentsetseg P. is a 52-year-old  widow. She lives alone in her ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent in Hentiy province in Mongolia. Her son lives separately from her. 

She started sewing clothing in her home in 1994 and since then has found success and moved to a rented space in 2006 where she makes a variety of clothing. After several years of work, her working capital now exceeds $660 and her earnings have enabled her to purchase her own sewing machine. 

Her hope is to keep growing her business and to have her own workplace. Herlentsetseg is requesting a 1,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more clothing fabric for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing fabric

loans.name: Felix Raul

texts.es:
El Sr. Raúl González M. trabaja como Vigilante en la Alcaldía de El Viejo, el habita Fte. A la Virgen de Hato (El Viejo).

El va a utilizar el crédito para cambiar el zinc de su casa ya que el invierno esta fuerte y le está dañando su hogar. 

El Sr. González M. es el segundo crédito que ha tenido con la Institución  y el anterior lo cancelo muy bien en tiempo y forma y espera  seguir trabajando con la Institución por más tiempo.
texts.en:
Raúl González M. works as a watchman at the El Viejo town hall. He lives in front of the Virgen del Hato in El Viejo.

He will use the loan to purchase zinc for his house because the winter is intense and it is damaging his home.

This is Mr. González M.’s second loan with the institution and he paid his previous loan very punctually. He hopes to continue working with CEPRODEL for longer.

loans.use: To make housing improvements (roof repair).

loans.name: Haydee Lucrecia

texts.es:
La Sra. López O. vive en el Municipio de Tonalá– Puerto Morazán.
Ella va a utilizar el crédito para Mejorar su habitación ya que está embarazada y necesita realizarle mejoras para esperar el nacimiento de su bebe.
La Sra. López O. ha tenido 05 créditos en la Institución los cuales todos los anteriores los ha cancelado muy bien en tiempo y forma y manifiesta sentirse muy feliz por trabajar con CEPRODEL, ya espera seguir trabajando por mas años.
texts.en:
Ms. López O. lives in the municipality of Tonalá in Puerto Morazán.

She will use the loan to make improvements to her room because she is pregnant and needs to make improvements before her baby is born.

Ms. López O. has had five loans with the institution and has repaid her previous loans very punctually. She expresses her happiness working with CEPRODEL and hopes to continue working with them for years to come.
