Lilian is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by learning more literature and getting more knowledge on day to day life.

loans.use: to buy oil treatment for hair and braids

loans.name: Lucia Ivania

texts.es:
LUCIA IVANIA G.,Trabaja Como Ayudante de cocina en el centro capacitación alemán CECNA.
ha trabajado tres prestamos con ceprodel y tosdos estos han sido para el mejoramiento de su casa de habitacion.Ella va utilizar la plata en la mejora de su Casa de Habitación que piensa  comprar algunas lamina de zinc  casa de habitación y solventar algunos gastos familiares.
es madre de familia soltera y tiene un hijo a su cargo y este se encuentra en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Lucia Ivania G. is kitchen assistant working inthe National Technological Institute named CECNA (Centro de Capacitación  Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán).
She has been granted three loans by Ceprodel, and they have all been used to make improvements to her house. She will use the money she is requesting to make more improvements to her house, as she plans on buying some zinc sheets, as well as to pay for family expenses.
She a single mother: her son attends school and is economically dependent on her.

loans.use: To make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To change the electrical wiring and to whitewash some walls of her house.

loans.name: Mayra Amparo

texts.es:
MAYRA AMPARO G. G.,Trabaja como Intructor de Belleza en el centro capacitación alemán nicaragüense  CECNA, ha trabajado dos prestamos con ceprodel y estos han sido para el mejoramiento de su casa de habitacion, ella tiene dos y estos se encuentran en edad escolar.
el prestamo utilizado es para la compra de  materiales de construcción  de su casa va cambiar el Sistema Electrico de su casa, y el resto en gastos familiares  que tiene pendiente.
texts.en:
Mayra Amparo G. G. is a Beauty instructor working for the National Technological Institute named CECNA (Centro de Capacitación  Profesional Nicaragüense Alemán). She has been granted two loans by Ceprodel, which have been used to improve her house. She has two children who are still in school.
The loan she is requesting will be used to buy building materials for her house: she will change the electrical wiring of her house. She will use part of the loans to settle a few unpaid family expenses as well.

loans.use: To change the electrical wiring of her house and to settle family expenses.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es: El señor Juan T. trabaja arduamente para llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación. Actualmente requiere mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda que ha estado en malas condiciones y para ello ha solicitado un crédito para ser invertido en la compra de los materiales de construcción y de esta manera brindarle mejores condiciones de vida a su amada familia.Espera que su crédito sea otorgado y así llevar a cabo su sueño de reconstrucción de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan Pablo Tujillo O. is a security guard working for COMMEMA* at the Wholesale Market of Mangua. He has been granted five loans by Ceprodel, and they have all been used to make improvements to his house.
The loan he is requesting will be used to buy materials for the rebuilding of his house and to whitewash the walls, as well as to solve a few family problems.

* COMMEMEA is the acronym for “Corporación Municipal de Mercados de Managua” (Managua Municipal Markets Corporation)

loans.use: To make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Yesenia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Yesenia, se dedica a la preparacion y venta de tamales, tiene 20 años de edad, vive con su esposo, su hija de 2 años de edad y su madre, todos realizan algun trabajo para aportar al hogar y cubrir sus gastos. El negocio de Yesenia inicio con la ayuda principalmente de su madre quien se dedicaba a vender tamales y le enseño a prepararlos, ella los vende el los alrededores de la zona donde sale todos los dias a ofrecerlos, no tiene un horario fijo pues depende de cuanto se tarde en venderlos.
Ella solicita un prestamo para la compra de Elotes que es su materia prima y los productos adicionales para la preparacion de los tamales, este prestamo ayudara a comprar los elotes por gran cantidad, que le den buen precio para que pueda ver mas ganancias en sus ventas.
Las aspiraciones de Yesenia con el negocio es que pueda mejorar su condicion de comerciante y pueda generar mas ingresos para ayudar a su familia y das a su hija un futuro diferente.
texts.en:
Yesenia’s activity is to prepare and sell tamales. She is 20 years old, lives with her 2-year-old daughter, her husband and her mother, who all have some activity to contribute towards household expenses.

Yesenia's business began essentially with her mother’s support who sold tamales and taught her how to prepare them. She sells in the surrounding area where she offers her products daily, without a set schedule as it depends on how much time it takes to sell off her production.

She requests a loan to buy corn -which is her basic ingredient- and additional products for the preparation of tamales. This loan will enable her to buy corn in large quantities, so that the wholesalers may give her a discount and she can in turn increase her sales profits.

Yesenia’s aspirations for her business is to improve her status as a merchant, generate more revenue to help her family and provide her daughter with a different future.

loans.use: Compra de Elotes para preparar tamales

loans.name: Galina

texts.en:
Galina is married with two grown sons. She is a market entrepreneur from Berdyansk. She owns two kiosks where she sells dishware at reasonable prices. She started this enterprise eleven years ago. Presently, Galina has 45,000 UAH of working capital. Her income amounts to $1950 a month.  

Galina is seeking a 5,000 UAH loan to increase the assortment of dishware products in her kiosks. She likes working with this type of inventory. Galina is a diligent and determined market vendor. She knows what it takes to keep a business afloat. Galina works hard to make her small venture a successful business that will keep bringing her stable income in the future.

loans.use: to increase her assortment of merchandise

loans.name: Yanina Margarita

texts.es: La señora N. P. tiene un tramo en el Mercado municipal de Masaya, en el que ofrece diferentes tipos de ropa, con este negocio le ha facilitado el bienestar económico que necesita su familia ya que a sus hijos les ha brindado lo mejor, en esta ocasión la señora está visitando las oficinas de Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito y poder comprar pantalones, camisas, blusas, vestidos y otros para tener mas variedad y aprovechar la temporada que viene porque para ella es mejor, y de esta forma poder dándole un mejor nivel de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Ms. N. P. owns a shop in the Municipal Market of Masaya, where she sells different types of clothes. Her activity has provided the economic welfare that her family needs, as she has given the best to her children. In this occasion Ms. N. P. has come to the offices of Ceprodel to ask for a loan she will use to buy trousers, shirts, blouses, dress and other items of clothing to have a wider variety of items and to take advantage of the upcoming season, as this is the best time for her activity: in this way she will be able to grant a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: To buy trousers, shirts, blouses, dresses and other items of clothing.

loans.name: Rita Soraya

texts.es: La señora C. N. elabora cosa de horno (es una repostería) que la comercializa en la zona de Nindirí con este negocio ha podido sobrevivir y salir adelante en conjunto con su esposo y su hija la cual es menor de edad, posee una experiencia en esta actividad de 5 años, ha logrado construir poco a poco su casa ya que anteriormente era de tabla y ahora la está haciendo de concreto, se acerca a CEPRODEL a solicitar un crédito para mejora de vivienda ya que quiere comprar laminas de zinc, hierro de 3/8, cemento, perlines, golosos, anticorrosivo y zener, para así vivir bien con su familia y no mojarse en la temporada de invierno.
texts.en: Ms. C. N. owns a confectioner’s shop where she prepares “Cosas de Horno” (a typical Nicaraguan pastry) that she then sells in the Nindirí area. Thanks to this activity she has succeeded in surviving and getting by together with her husband and their young daughter. She has been engaging in her activity for 5 years, and little by little she has succeeded in building her house: previously made of planks, she is now having g it rebuilt in concrete. She asked CEPRODEL for a loan she will use to make improvements to her house: she wants to buy zinc sheets, iron bars with a 3.8” diameter, cement, purlins, screws, antirust and paint thinner in order to live well with her family and avoid getting wet during the winter.

loans.use: To buy building materials to make improvements to her house.

loans.name: Zaida Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Zaida E. tiene un taller de zapatería en donde su especialidad es la bota militar y vaqueras, en esta rama ya tiene 33 años de experiencia, este taller lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación, al mismo tiempo la señora para tener un poco más de ingreso logro entrar a trabajar como maestra en un colegio que se llama Mundo Infantil en donde le dan clases a niños, ella visita a CEPRODEL con el fin de solicitar un crédito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboración del calzado como cuero, suela y plantina y poder estar estable con su familia.
texts.en: Ms. Zaida E. owns a shoemaking shop and she is specialized in military and cowboy boots. She has been engaging in this activity for 33 years, and the workshop is located in her house. At the same time, and to earn some more money, she succeeded in being employed as teacher in a school called Mundo Infantil (Children’s World), where she teaches small children. She has asked CEPRODEL for a loan that she will use to buy core materials she needs to make shoes such as leather, soles and insoles, in order to live a stable life with her family.

loans.use: To buy leather, soles and insoles.

loans.name: Adriana Azucena

texts.es: La señora C. desde hace once años se dedica al negocio de Cosméticos en donde ofrece diversas variedades de productos, ha logrado sufragar los gastos familiars de ella y su menor hija que se encuentra en edad escolar, ella nuevamente se acerca a CEPRODEL a solicitor un crédito para la compara de perfumes para damas y varón, y así poder darle un mejor nivel de vida a su hija.
texts.en: For eleven years, Mrs. C. has had a cosmetics business, where she offers a variety of products. She has been able to pay for her and her younger sister’s expenses. Her sister is currently in school. Mrs. C. is returning to CEPRODEL to request a loan to buy perfumes for men and women, so that she can offer a better life to her daughter.

loans.use: To buy perfumes for men and women

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: El señor G. Baquero tiene quince años de tener un negocio de sorbetería en su casa de habitación y otro en el parque central de Masaya, actualmente a la unica persona que tiene a su cargo es a su mamá quien padece de azúcar y él le provee de todos sus medicamentos por medio de este negocio, este señor se acerca a CEPRODEL a solicitor nuevamente crédito para aprovechar la temporada de las fiestas patrias y así generar un poco más de ganancia para la manutención de su familia.
texts.en: For fifteen years Mr. G. Baquero has been running an ice-cream parlor in his own house and another one in the central park of the town of  Masaya. Right now the only person depending on him is his mother, who is diabetic: through his activity he is able to buy her medicines. He asked CEPRODEL for a new loan in order to take advantage of the national holiday’s season and earn some more money to provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy core products for his ice-cream parlor

loans.name: Sandra María

texts.es: La señora L. D. es trabajadora de Fundación León 2000, labora como analista de crédito, ella con su ingreso logra sufragar los gastos de su menor hija quien está en edad escolar, ahorita esta señora se acerca a CEPRODEL a solicitar un crédito para realizar unos pagos personales
texts.en: Mrs. L. D. is a hard-working employee of Fundación León 2000, and she works as a loan analyst. With her income, she has been able to pay for the expenses of her younger sister, who is in school. At this time, she is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL for personal expenses.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Delia Marina

texts.es: La señora P. C. es profesora y labora en una escuela que se llama Camilo Zapata en una comarca que se llama Campuzano del Municipio de Nindirí desde hace 23 años, con el salario que devenga mantiene a dos hijas menores que tiene y las cuales se encuentran en edad escolar, esta señora se acerca a CEPRODEL a solicitar un crédito para gastos personales, y así no endeudarse para seguir sufragando la manutención a su hija.
texts.en: Mrs. P. C. is a teacher, and she has worked in a school called Camilo Zapata in the district of Campuzano in the municipality of Nindirí for 23 years. With her salary, she takes care of her two young daughters, who are in school. She is requesting a loan from CEPRODEL for personal expenses, so that she doesn’t become indebted in taking care of her daughters.

loans.use: Personal expenses

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina Z. es una señora de 51 años de edad, casada y madre de siete hijos,  reside en la Aldea La Concepción en Juticalpa, Olancho y se dedica a la elaboración de rosquillas, pan, quesadillas, y hojaldras. De lunes a sábado ella y sus hijas se levantan a las 5:00 am para iniciar la jornada laboral preparando los ingredientes para hornear, y mientras el pan y los demás productos se están horneando ella se va arreglando para salir a venderlos a su puesto ubicado a las afueras de la alcaldía municipal en el centro de la ciudad de Juticalpa y está allí hasta las 6:00 pm. Solicita el préstamo para comprar maíz, leña y dulce, componentes necesarios para preparar sus productos. Con el apoyo de este préstamo espera seguir teniendo una fuente de ingreso para seguir ayudando a sus hijos a terminar sus estudios secundarios.  Desde hace 8 años Alejandrina es clienta de FAMA y con los préstamos que ha obtenido ha podido llevar el sostenimiento a su familia, su sueño es tener una panadería.
texts.en:
Alexandria Z. is 51 years old, married and the mother of seven children. She lives in the borough of La Concepcion in Juticalpa, Olancho and imakes donuts, bread, quesadillas, and wafers.

Monday through Saturday she and her daughters get up at 5:00 am to start the workday by preparing the ingredients for baking. While the bread and other products are baking she gets ready to go sell her products at a stand located outside the municipal hall in the center of the city of Juticalpa. She is there until 6:00 pm.

She is requesting a loan to buy corn, wood and sweeteners, all needed in the preparation of her products. With the support of the loan she hopes to maintain a source of income which will help her children to finish high school. Alexandrina has been a client of Fame for the past eight years and with the loans she received has been able to sustain her family. Her dream is to own a bakery.

loans.use: Buy corn, wood and sweeteners

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: The borrower has a silencer repair shop for repairing and changing car’s silencers. He is 45 years old, a primary school graduate, and married with four children. He will use this loan to develop his shop and purchase silencers for new cars imported to the country. The borrower has a good reputation in the area, has gained many clients and has very good experience in this field of business.

loans.use: To develop his shop and purchase silencers

loans.name: Munhtsetseg

texts.en:
Munhtsetseg L. is 46 years old and lives with her husband and two sons in Hentiy province, Mongolia. Her older son is currently unemployed, and her younger son attends a local secondary school. Her husband works as a carpenter in an Arvin shop and receives a monthly salary of 150,000 MNT.

Munhtsetseg usually produces a traditional Mongolian shoe called a Buriad (the name of a Mongolian tribe) shoe that is just right for the cold Mongolian winters. In addition, she operates a clothing sewing and repair business to supplement her earnings. She started her business five years ago and has built a stable and successful operation with many permanent customers.

Munhtsetseg is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan to purchase materials for her sewing business. She is planning to move into a rented space in the near future. She hopes to have her own workplace someday.

loans.use: To purchase materials for her sewing business

loans.name: Nergui

texts.en:
Nergui E., age 30, lives with her husband, daughter and grandmother in Hentiy province, Mongolia. She and her family live in a traditional Mongolian housing tent called a ger on a small plot of land which they rent. Her daughter attends middle school while her husband works as a herder. The family owns 153 head of livestock.

Since 2009 Nergui has been operating a clothing repair service in a small rented workplace in Uguuj trade center in town. She makes and sells a variety of clothing items. Her business has grown quickly within a short period and has garnered many permanent customers.

Nergui is requesting a 450,000 MNT loan to purchase more sewing materials for her business. She is a hardworking and generous woman. In the future, she plans to purchase necessary tools and equipment for her sewing business.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline B. is 41 years old, married and has three school-aged children. She is from the village of D'ban Calamba in Misamis Occidental province on the Mindanao islands. Evangeline sells furniture for the home to tourists and local community members. Evangeline has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 2000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Evangeline joined GDMPC to gain access to its financial services. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC that was used to purchase the raw materials needed to make her furniture. Evangeline is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement her family's income.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase materials needed to make furniture

loans.name: Aljane

texts.en:
Aljane F. is from the village of Poblacion 2 in Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 30 years old, married, and has an infant. To make a living, Aljane owns and operates a retail store, while not the only means of generating revenue the main source of income is from selling clothes like blouses and others in the local community.Aljane engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.  


In 2009, Aljane joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous GDMPC loan of 15000 PHP used to to repair a business transport vehicle. Aljane is requesting her third loan, for 20000 PHP, to purchase additional products to sell.

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy more products to sell.

loans.name: Celia

texts.en: Celia R. is from the city of Bacolod, Ozamiz City. She is 49 years old. Celia is single and has an adult child. To make a living, Celia operates a transportation service. Celia has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Celia joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Celia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 40,000 PHP from GDMPC. Celia is requesting a new loan of 27,813.30 PHP, which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be the second loan taken out by Celia from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Bemma's Group

texts.en: Bemma R. is from the village of Sepac, Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old. Bemma is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if she is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Shasta Daisy. Bemma is married and has an infant. To make a living, Bemma owns and operates a store, selling daily-use products such as milk, coffee, sugar, canned goods, pancit (noodles), shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Bemma has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Bemma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Bemma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Bemma is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the second loan taken out by Bemma from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Gezardo

texts.en:
Gezardo D. is from the town of Trinidad. He is 41 years old. Gezardo is married. To make a living, Gezardo operates a fishing business. The main source of income for the business comes from gathering and selling seaweed to the market. Gezardo is currently renovating his house so that his family will have a better shelter. He works hard to earn better and be able to finish their house.

Gezardo joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gezardo is requesting a new loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP), which will be used to purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: To purchase fishing equipment, including hooks and nets

loans.name: Balbina

texts.en:
Balbina N. is from the village of San Isidro, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 61 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community.  She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $163 a month for these activities.

In 2007, Balbina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Balbina is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 8th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia A. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old, married, and has six adult-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells specialty foods for desserts and snacks in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lucia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Maeluna

texts.en:
Maeluna C. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 30 years old and married. To make a living, she operates a fishing business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from gathering and selling seaweed at the market. She hopes to improve the living conditions of her family. 

Maeluna joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fishing equipment including nets. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to their house.

loans.use: to purchase fishing equipment including nets

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan A. is from the village of Bonbon, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 51 years old, married, and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she makes and sells specialty dishes in the local community. Susan has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately $113 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Susan joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the products she sells

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha P. is from the village of San Isidro, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 44 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $190 a month for these activities.

In 2008, Editha joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Editha is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 6th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Simona Esperanza

texts.es:
La Sra. Simona Esperanza Munguía F.,  es comerciante activa   del mercado la terminal, inicia a exhibir su mercadería desde las 6 am posteriormente se desplaza a vender ambulante en los buses quedando en su puesto fijo su esposo y este crédito lo utilizo para incrementar su inventario de cosmético tales como: pinturas, vanidades, crema, shampoo, aretes, piraña, gorra, etc. Ella realizas sus compras una parte en Managua y otra a proveedores que le entregan en su puesto de venta.

Sra. Munguía F. está muy agradecida con ceprodel por que le ha ayudado a crecer su negocio con cosméticos y chinería ya que ella solo vendía pan
texts.en:
Mrs. Simona Esperanza Munguía F. is an active businesswoman in the market. She begins by displaying her merchandise at 6 am, and then she sells her products at bus stops. She and her husband will use this loan to increase their inventory of cosmetics such as makeup, vanities, cream, shampoo, earrings, caps, etc. She makes part of her purchases in Managua and the other part from suppliers that come to her stand.

Mrs. Munguía F. is very thankful for Ceprodel because they have helped her grow her cosmetics and China business since she used to only sell bread.

loans.use: To buy lipstick, nailpolish, shampoo, vanities, cream, earrings, etc.

La Sra. A.  es comerciante del M. la terminal donde inicia a ofertar su producto desde la 5 am. Y finaliza a las 3 pm. Este crédito lo solicita para comprar por mayor su producto y así obtener mayor ganancia, y lograr mejorar su nivel de vida realizándole mejora a su vivienda.

La Sra. está muy agradecida con Ceprodel  por que le ha ayudado que su negocio crezca.
texts.en:
Sra. A. is a merchant in La Terminal market, where she begins selling her product at 5:00 a.m. She finishes at 3:00 p.m.

The loan she is applying for is for the wholesale purchase of her product so that she obtains greater earnings and succeeds in improving her standard of living and carrying out improvements to her home. Sra. A. is thankful to Ceprodel because it has helped with the growth of her business.

Now requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs, he plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve his agricultural venture.

texts.es:
La Sra. Isidra de Jesús R.,  realiza sus compras a las 5:00 am posteriormente se dedica a vender en su puesto fijo y sus hijas se movilizan ambulantes. El crédito lo utiliza para la compra de bananos, chiltomas, tomate, gaseosas y jugos vareados, etc., al por mayor y así logra obtener mejores ganancias.

Sra. R. está muy agradecida con ceprodel por que le ha ayudado a crecer su negocio con frutas y verduras el cual ella ante de obtener estos crédito  solo vendía agua y gaseosas.
texts.en:
Sra. Isidra de Jesus R. buys produce at 5:00 in the morning and then works with her daughters at selling it, she in her market stall and her daughters on the streets of the town.  She will use the loan to buy wholesale supplies of bananas, peppers, tomatoes, soft drinks and juices which she can then sell on at higher prices.  

Sra. R. is very grateful to CEPRODEL because they have helped her develop a fruit and vegetable business.  Before, she used to only sell water and soft drinks.

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Ariunaa

texts.en:
Ariunaa B. is a 26 years old, single woman.  She lives with her parents and sister in a Mongolian nomadic dwelling called 'ger' in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Both her parents are retired and her sister, Navchaa, is currently pursuing a master's degree in university. Ariunaa stopped attending university because she was not able to pay her tuition fees.  

Ariunaa manages a grocery trading business in a rented space in the local community. She has been operating her business since 2009 after working as a salesperson at a shop. Her business has grown quickly within a short period of time.  She sells cell phones in addition to food stuff. Her earnings have enabled her to pay her sister's tuition fees and to contribute to her family's income as well. In the future, she wants to continue studying and to purchase her own land with a fence. Ariunaa is a diligent and hardworking woman. She says: "I am planning to complete my undergraduate degree."  

Ariunaa is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to become an official distributor for a cell phone service provider and sell cell phones through her grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase cell phones to sell in her store.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

C., se dedica la venta de refrescos en el mercado la estación, inicia las 6:00 am y finaliza a la 1:00 pm, solicita este crédito para compras de semilla, cacao y productos varios el cual ella le agradece a ceprodel porque con los créditos que le ha brindado, ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo con productos populares, donde obtiene una mayor ganancia para la mantención de su hogar.
texts.en: Sra. Rosa Elena Perez C. operates a business selling cold drinks at the market in the station.  She works from 6:00 in the morning to 1:00 in the afternoon.  She will use this loan to buy ingredients for making the products she sells.  Sra. Perez is very grateful to CEPRODEL because the extra working capital she's received has allowed her to make products that her customers want and, in turn, increased her earnings.

loans.use: Buy products to resell.

loans.name: Nubia De Los Santos

texts.es:
La Sra. S.,  realiza sus ventas en la parada de buses interlocales León-Managua, el crédito lo utilizó para compra de gaseosas variadas, jugos variados y cosa de horno.

Sra. S. está muy agradecida con ceprodel por que le ha ayudado a comprar variedad de productos y así realizado mayores ventas, obteniendo buenas ganancias lo que le ha permitido mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Sra. Saenz operates her business at the stop for the Leon-Managua intercity bus service.  She will use the loan to buy soft drinks, juices and homemade snacks.

Sra. Saenz is very grateful to CEPRODEL because they have helped her buy new products and increase her sales, help that has increased her earnings and allowed her to improve her house.

loans.use: Compra de gaseosas variadas, jugos y cosa de horno

loans.name: Maricyle

texts.en:

To make a living, Maricyle owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling of coconuts in the local community. Maricyle has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maricyle joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maricyle has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to invest in expanding the business. Maricyle is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Maricyle from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La Sra. R. M.,  inicia a ofertar su producto en el mercado la terminal desde las 8:00 am hasta las 5:00 pm, el crédito fue utilizado para compras de pacas de ropa usada de mejor calidad donde ha podido aumentar su clientela y así ha podido obtener un mayor ingreso.

Sra. R. está muy agradecida con ceprodel por que le ha ayudado a crecer su negocio con la compra de ropa de mejor calidad y así ha logrado su situación económica y laboral.
texts.en:
Ms. R. M. begins selling her products in the terminal market at 8:00 AM and continues to 5:00 PM.  She used the money from this loan to buy bundles of good quality second hand clothing.  She’s been able to increase her customer base and obtain a better income.

Mrs. R. is thankful to CEPRODEL.  The help they have given her has allowed her to grow her business with the purchase of clothing in quantity.  This has helped her financial and work situation.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Esperanza Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Sra. Esperanza del Socorro L., se dedica la venta de electrodomésticos al crédito a los comerciantes del mercado la terminal, los cuales le realizan abonos diarios. Ella realizas sus compras en Managua 2 veces en el mes.

Ella realiza 3 recorridos de cobros en el día a sus clientes y se siente muy satisfecha con ceprodel porque ha logrado mantener estable su negocio.
texts.en:
Esperanza del Socorro L. sells domestic appliances on credit to merchants at the terminal market.  They make daily payments to her.  She buys her stock twice a month in Managua.

She makes three daily trips to visit her customers and is very happy with CEPRODEL because they have helped her maintain a stable business.

loans.use: Domestic appliances for resale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia G. is from the village of Abu, Baylao, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Lydia is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lydia owns and operates a business providing pedicure and manicure services for the local community. Lydia has been engaged in her business for more than 10 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Lydia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Lydia is requesting a loan of 4000 PHP, which will be used to purchase materials needed to provide service. This will be the first loan taken by Lydia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase manicure and pedicure supplies

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar S. is 33 years old. She lives in Geghamavan village, Sevan area. Gohar is married and has two sons: one of them studies at the State Engineering University in Yerevan, and second one goes to school in Geghamavan village. 

Gohar and her husband have engaged in sheep breeding for a long time and with profits from their business, they support their family and pay for their elder son’s education. 

Gohar would like a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy 20 or 25 sheep for her farm, and that will allow her to develop her livestock business and increase her family’s income in near future.

loans.use: To buy 20 or 25 sheep for her farm

loans.name: Josefa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Sra. Josefa de Jesús G., se dedica la venta de verduras ofreciendo su producto en el mercado la terminal, iniciando sus labores desde las 5:00 am y finalizándolas a las 6:00 pm.

La Sra. Solicita el crédito para realizar compras de quequisque, chayotes, papas, cebolla, tomates, arroz, azúcar, aceite al por mayor, gracias a los créditos brindados por ceprodel ha logrado incrementar su inventario además de vender venturas hoy vende granos básicos.
texts.en:
Josefa de Jesús G. sells fruit at the terminal market.  She begins working at 5:00 AM and finishes at 6:00 PM.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy inventory such as chayote squash, potatoes, onions, tomatoes, rice, sugar, and cooking oil in bulk.  Thanks to the CEPRODEL loans, she’s been able to expand her inventory.  Aside from vegetables, she now also sells basic grains.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Lolinie

texts.en:
Lolinie D. C. is 43 years old, married to Marcelino D. C. and blessed with four children. Her two eldest are 20 and 19 years old, and both are college students; the two youngest are 17 and 6 and are in high school and grade school, respectively. 

Lolinie is a member of Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.(ASHI) – partner MFI of Kiva in the Philippines since 2006. She is one of the upcoming entrepreneurs of the institution. Her reputation as member is a great example to those who are determined to improve their lives. 

From the profit of their buy-and-sell business and her husband's income, they have been able to collect capital that they can use for a transportation business. However, she is applying for a loan of Php 40,000 pesos for additional capital to purchase a passenger jeepney to transport people with fare from Antipolo City to Quezon City here in the Philippines. 

Their savings is not enough to make the purchase, so she decided to apply for a new loan. The income from this new venture will greatly help the family, especially for the education of her children, whom she wishes to finish their courses and find good jobs. The couple also dreams of having their own house and lot in the future. 

All she desires is that ASHI and KIVA friends will support her until she reaches her dreams. She will repay all the good things she now receives by fulfilling her duties and responsibilities as a member and mother of her family with diligence.

loans.use: Additional capital for buying a passenger jeepney

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy D. is from the village of Tagdo, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 34 years old. Jimmy is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Jimmy owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Jimmy is just starting this business.

In 2010, Jimmy joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jimmy has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Jimmy is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory and working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Jimmy from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Shatarmaa

texts.en:
Shatarmaa D. is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the Songinohairhan district of Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. All five members of the family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Her oldest son has recently finished high school and currently stays at home while her two younger children both attend secondary school. Her husband works as a guard at a local company. 

Shatarmaa operates a shoe-making business in a rented space where she produces a variety of traditional boots and shoes. She has been working as a shoe-making teacher at Ugalz vocational training center since 2006. She also has started her own business. 

She has been selling her products at the largest main market of Ulaanbaatar, Narantuul. In 2010, she stopped teaching at the training center and moved to a rented workplace where she is growing her own business. Over the years of operation, she has been able to improve her family's income and also to provide for her children's educational costs. 

Her goals are to one day own her own shoe-making workshop and continue to provide for her household's needs. Shatarmaa is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase more shoe-making materials in order to increase sales.

loans.use: To purchase more shoe-making materials

loans.name: Florida

texts.en:
Florida P. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 50 years old. Florida is single and has four adult children. Florida owns and operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Florida has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 6,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2008, Florida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Florida has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to invest in renovating her store. Florida is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & as working capital. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Florida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonisa H. explains to us how hard their life was before she joined Ahon sa Hirap, Inc., a partner MFI of Kiva in the Philippines. She relates how their situation often kept them from access to capital. No one trusted them with any amount until ASHI came to the island--their home. 

Married to a fisherman, and because of the abundance of fish in the lake, she invested her loan in fishing. She bought fishing gadgets for her husband and she sells the catch. After 9 years their life has improved and they even sent their children through high school. 

Today she is applying for a loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy materials for building a fish trap (locally known as “baklad”) worth 6,000 PHP including payment for labor.  The remaining 9,000 will be used for the repair of their pump boat. 

She hopes that Kiva lenders will always support her in this business plan and will continue to do so until she is able to put up a larger fishing business. She is still dreaming that her 3 children will pursue a career in college or vocational courses.

loans.use: buying a fish trap; repairing fishing boat

loans.name: Halima

texts.en: Halima is a 37 year-old married lady who is blessed with two children aged 3 and 4.  She runs a beauty shop and has one employee. She was previously employed before she went into the business.  She says that she has become more focused in her business since she joined Faulu Kenya.  She has requested 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy beauty products.  She hopes to sell beauty products in wholesale in the future.  She sees herself opening more outlets for her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy beauty products

loans.name: Zeban's Group

texts.en:
Zeban belongs to a mid-sized city called Vehari, which is located in Punjab, Pakistan and known for its agriculture industry. She owns a three room brick house there and lives in it with her family. 

She is married to M. A. who works in the field and sows wheat and rice etc. He owns a small piece of land and sells his finished products to different markets. 

Zeban is a very talented lady. She embroiders dresses and earns a good income. She has a good knowledge of this art and produces quality work that helps her receive regular orders every month. Her income allows her to manage the family's finances with her husband.  

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan amount her husband will buy seeds, fertilizer, and other supplies to increase the productivity of his crops. Zeban is hopeful that her husband will put forth all the effort necessary to gain a positive result from his business.

loans.use: buying seeds & fertilizer for sowing wheat & rice

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 50-year-old humble and respectful man.  He does dairy farming to earn a living.  In addition, he runs a cafeteria.  He has been running the business for ten years with two employees.  He hopes that someday, he will improve his living standards. Joseph is a registered member of Faulu Kenya under Gathaithi Tuinuane group.  Since he joined the group, his financial status has improved.  He had previously serviced one loan and he has requested  another loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy a cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos A. lives in the village of Sorosoro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 59 years old, married and has four grown children. To make a living, he owns a variety store where he sells items people need daily, such as food and toiletries. Carlos has been in this business for more than 11 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from his work.

Earlier this year, Carlos joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his life and ability to engage in business. He is applying for a loan, his first, for 5,000 PHP to buy additional products to sell to his customers. He plans to use the additional revenue generated by his business to continue expanding his small company.

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita J. is a 50-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating three businesses: fishing, buying and selling charcoal, and running a general store. She lives in Prk. Catlagan, Brgy. Basak, Cauayan, Negros Occidental and has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2004. She has done an outstanding job of using loans from NWTF to improve her life and make her family more stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 12,000. In order to improve her fishing business, she is applying for a new loan, her 14th, for PHP 29,500. Her goal is to continue elevating her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon (or honorable) way.  

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: to expand her fishing business

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina L. lives in the village of Sorosoro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 40 years old, married and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she runs a small variety store where she sells food and other items people need every day. She has been in this line of work for more than two years, and earns about 5,000 PHP a month.

Earlier this year, Cristina joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for a loan, her first, for 5,000 PHP to buy additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue made possible by this loan to continue improving and expanding her store.  

About HSPFI:

loans.name: Rukhsana's Group

texts.en:
Rukhsana lives in a mid-sized Pakistani city called Vehari. She moved there when she married her husband, M. A., and now lives in a small three-room brick house. She is a housewife who stays at home and takes care of household responsibilities, but also leads this six-person loan group. She is not educated because her parents couldn’t afford to send her to school, and needed her at home to help take care of chores and cook food. This experience has made her a good wife and mother who is widely respected in her community. 
 
Her husband is a private entrepreneur who runs a shop where he sells fruit, buying it wholesale and making a good profit by selling it retail in a local market. Rukhsana has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to help expand her husband’s business. He will use this loan to buy fruit in bulk and increase his sales. Rukhsana hopes that this investment will be a great help for her husband’s business and mean an improved life for her family.

loans.use: To buy fruits in quantity for resale

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa H. lives in the village of Sorosoro, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old, married and has five school-aged children. She makes a living by running a store where she buys and sells clothes and shoes. She has been in this business for more than five years and earns about 6,000 PHP a month from her work.

Earlier this year, Marissa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her life and ability to engage in business. She is applying for her loan, her first, for 5,000 PHP, to buy more products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by her store to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy new items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Leziel

texts.en:
Leziel A. is a married woman who lives in Purok 1, Brgy. Basak, Cauayan, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a rice-retailing business. Her husband Joenel, who is 43 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business. They have three children aged between 19 and 23.
Leziel joined Kiva partner, NWTF-Project Dungganon, in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Leziel has been gradually lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 19,500 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 4,000 PHP, thus raising her family's standard of living. This time, for her ninth loan, she is borrowing 19,500 PHP, which she intends to use to buy more stock to sell so that she is able to continue to save up for the future expansion of her business.
Leziel A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means 'honorable'). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them 'Dungganon' – a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of the community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: To buy more stock

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Vergie

texts.en:
Vergie C. is from the village of Tupsan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 34 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Vergie owns and operates a specialized retail store selling clothing, sandals and shoes in the local community. Vergie has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Vergie joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Aalan Yaseen's Group

texts.en:
Aalan lives in the small Pakistani city of Vehari. She has been living in a small area named 555/EB in a three-roomed brick house with her family for many years.
Aalan is a quality embroiderer. She crafts beautiful embroidery designs on different types of clothes. She is an expert in preparing wedding clothes. She has been in this business for the past eight years and receives regular orders every month. She knows different embroidery techniques and applies these in making new designs.
Aalan is married to Y. who runs a grocery shop in the nearby market. He sells daily use items such as eggs, sugar, rice and spices. His sales help him to make more income. Aalan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner, Asasah, for her husband’s business. With the loan, her husband will buy grocery items in bulk for his grocery shop. These will increase his sales and income because he will have more products to offer to his customers. Aalan is hopeful that this investment will bring positive changes to her husband’s business and that her family’s living standard will improve.

loans.use: To buy grocery items in bulk

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn F. is a 47-year-old mother of three children. Her eldest children (21 and 18 years old respectively) are in college while the youngest (8 years old) is a grade 2 pupil. Marilyn is a very determined and dynamic mother who joined Kiva partner, Ahon sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI), in the Philippines in 2006. To gain access to capital she prefers ASHI to other MFIs because she is motivated by the principles of the institution. After several years of being in the program she talks about the big improvement in her life. She has been able to earn profits from her previous loans that have helped her family meet their daily expenses and children's educational expenses.
Now, Marilyn is applying for a loan of 45,000 PHP to finance her transportation business. She will buy ten rickshaw units at the price of 4,500 PHP per unit. Part of her business plan is to increase the number of her rickshaws to earn more income and at the same time provide more employment, especially to out-of-school youth who want to drive her rickshaws. Because of the many blessings she has received from joining the program, she also wants to share these with other people. What she often wishes is for her children to finish college and earn degrees and for her business to be stable and earning profits. Again, she is hoping for more Kiva lenders to provide her with financial assistance so that she can improve her business and help other people.

loans.use: To buy ten rickshaw units

loans.name: Jane Jemutai

texts.en:
Jane Jemutai R., a hardworking lady of 50, is married to Ben Lagat, a mechanic, and together they have three children aged 22, 18, and 13 years of age.They live in Burn forest, located outside of Eldoret town. Jane has been farming for about 20 years, earning a monthly income of Kshs. 25,000.

Having only recently learned about KADET LTD, Jane is applying for her first loan of Kshs. 40,000 with which she intends to buy pesticides to spray wheat and pyrethrum. She will use the profits from the expanded business to start dairy farming, which is also very marketable in this area.

Jane hopes to grow her business, become a leading local investor, and see her children realize their dreams in life through education.

loans.use: To buy pestcides to spray wheat and pyrethrum

loans.name: Nova

texts.en: Nova L. is from the village of St. Joseph Village, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 33 years old. Nova is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Nova runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily-use products in the local community. Nova has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Nova joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nova is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Nova from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. loans.name: Elenita

texts.en:
Elenita S. is from the town of Trinidad. She is 54 years old. Elenita is married and has four school-aged children. She is a fish vendor. She buys directly from the fishermen and sells assorted fish to the market. She also owns a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells a variety of different products. Her store needs to be repaired.

Elenita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elenita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Elenita is requesting a new loan of 4,000 Phiippine pesos, which will be used to purchase more fish to sell and to repair her sari-sari store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

loans.use: To purchase more fish to sell and to repair her sari-sari (variety) store

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita C. is 51 years old, married and has three adult-aged children. She is from the village of Del Pilar within the municipality of Cabatuan, a part of Isabela province on the Luzon islands. Perlita runs a general store from which she sells both food and daily use products to the local community. Perlita is just starting this business.

In 2009 Perlita joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. Perlita successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell. Perlita is requesting a new loan, her fourth from ASKI, of 12,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement the family's income.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

Harvey runs a sari-sari (variety) shop from which he sells both food and daily use products to the local community. Harvey has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month.

loans.name: Chenda

texts.en:
Mr. Chenda N., is 39 years old and lives with his widowed mother in a village along National Road Number Two, approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. He has been a solder since 1988.

The motorbike pictured with Chenda is old and breaks down very often, is costly to repair and uses more gasoline than newer motorbikes. Hence Chenda is asking for his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a new one.

loans.use: To purchase new motorbike for commuting.

loans.name: Hamat

texts.en:
Mr. Hammat Y. (in the photo) is 32 years old and his wife, Mrs. Srifas Mat, is 30 years old. They live along National Road Number Six about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married for more than nine years and have five daughters. Two of them are in school and the others are still young and stay at home. 

Hammat is fisherman; he fishes from the lake near his house and the river. His wife sells the fish that her husband caught in the local market. In addition, the couple is also creating another business by buying recycling materials from villagers for resale to middlemen, who then take the items to Phnom Penh for sale. 

Hammat is asking for a loan of $600 to purchase a boat motor for his fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase a boat motor for his fishing business

loans.name: Leo

texts.en:
Leo S. is 34 years old, married and has one school-aged child. He is from the village of Poblacion, a part of Mambajao municipality in Camiguin province on the Mindanao islands. Leo provides motorela (a three-wheeled vehicle powered by a motorcycle) and habal-habal (motorcycle) services to local community members. Leo has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Leo joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. Leo is requesting a loan, his first, of 5000 PHP that will be used to purchase materials needed for the maintenance of his service vehicles. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business.

About HSPFI:

Hagdan sa Pag-uswag Foundation, Inc., or HSPFI, is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en:
Mrs. Sim H. is 47 years old, and her husband, Mr. Sambath Chhorn (pictured with his wife), is 45 years old. They have been married since 1988 and have six children, one son and five daughters. One of her daughters is a garment factory worker, one assists her mother in her business and the others attend school. The family lives in a village along National Road Number Two approximately thirteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Sim has been making porridge and Khmer noodles, or Num Banh Chok, to sell in her village for the past five years. Khmer noodles are considered the national dish of Cambodia and is served with a green curry soup and banana flowers, bean sprouts, water lily stalks and cucumbers. Her husband has been a construction worker for three years; he also drives a motor taxi when he is free.

Sim is asking for a loan of 700 USD to purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her daughter to drive to work.

loans.name: Tsetsegmaa

texts.en:
Tsetsegmaa D. is 50 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Hentiy province, Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic housing tent. Her older son works in the Hentiy Us company, while her daughter is a student and her young son attends a local school. Her husband is a herder.

Tsetsegmaa operates a milk and dairy product trading business in her town. She started her business in 2000 by milking her four cows to sell their milk at the market and since then she was successfully able to expand her business. Today she has fifteen cows that can produce eighty liters of milk during summer and forty to fifty liters of milk during the winter. Over the years she has built up a stable operation, and her daily income has reached between 30,000 and 40,000 MNT.

In the future Tsetsegmaa hopes to enlarge her stockyard and establish a large dairy. She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase hay to feed her cows as well as to buy a barn.

loans.use: To purchase hay to feed her cows

loans.name: Nela

texts.en: Nela L. is from the village of Binaliwan, Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 45 years old. Nela is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Nela makes and sells food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies like suman, a Filipino native rice cake delicacy, in the local community. Nela has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Nela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nela is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Nela from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Prescila

texts.en:
Prescila B. is a 34-year-old mother who sews and is married to Joel B., a fisherman. The are living on an island located in the middle of Laguna de Bay in the Philippines. Married at an early age, they now have five children, the eldest of whom is 16 years old, followed by the ages of 15, 12, 3 and 1 year old. 

According to her, raising their five children with a meager income is so difficult; that is why the couple agreed to join Ahon sa Hirap, Inc., (ASHI), a partner MFI (microfinance institution) of Kiva in the Philippines, to have access in capital. Her first and second loans were utilized in buying raw materials for her sewing business and fishing gadgets for her husband to use in fishing, their primary source of income. With both earning income, their life started to improve. 

To further earn profit this time, she is applying for a loan of 20,000.00 pesos to finance a fish cage. She will buy rolls of fishnets, bamboo poles and fish fingerlings and pay for labor for the construction. She is hoping that this loan will be funded so that she can fulfill her dreams for her family, especially the schooling of their children, and earn more capital from the proceeds in order to expand their fishing business. She plans to invest in fish trading in the future. She prays that Kiva lenders will always support her goals until she reaches success.

loans.use: To buy materials for a fish cage: rolls of fishnet, bamboo poles and fingerlings and to pay for labor for the construction

loans.name: Virgie

texts.en: Virgie C. is from the village of Del Pilar, Cabatuan, Isabela. She is 36 years old. Virgie is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Virgie runs a food stall. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling fruits and vegetables in the community. Virgie has operated her fruits-and-vegetables vending business for almost three years and she is earning approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) monthly. In 2009, Virgie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virgie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Virgie is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to have additional inventory and working capital. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Virgie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.name: Seiha

texts.en:
Mr. Seiha Y., is 35 years old, and his wife, Mrs. Thoun Kchorng (pictured), is 38 years old. They live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 2004 and have two children, one son and one daughter. Both of them are still young. 

Seiha has been driving a motor taxi for two years; his wife sells chicken in the local market. His motorbike is old and breaks often, so he spends a lot of money to repair it. Facing this, he decided to ask for his first loan of $600. He will use the loan to purchase a new motorbike to replace the old one.

Mr. Seiha Y. was not available for the picture, so his wife is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle for continuing his motor taxi business

loans.name: Ononherlen

texts.en:
Ononherlen B. is 29 years old and lives with her husband and 2-year-old son in the Hentiy province of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a "ger," a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent home. Her son attends a local kindergarten while her husband works as a police officer in the local police department and receives a monthly salary of 250,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). 

Ononherlen owns a computer and copier service as well as stationary trading business and runs it in a rented office in her town. She started her business in 2008 by operating with only one computer; since then, she has found success over the years. Her working capital has reached 600,000 MNT and her total assets, including all her computers and equipment, are worth 10,000,000 MNT today. 

In the future, she hopes to have her own workplace. She says, "I will use my business earnings to build a new workplace for the future." 

She is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan to purchase more inventory such as paper and ink for her business.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en: Xuan T. L. is 46 years old. She has two children who are workers for an industrial park. Xuan has been running her farming activities for years and has considerabL. income from this. Currently, she is raising 20 pigs for meat, which is sold wholesaL.. Joining with our credit program in 2006, she has used loans effectively and has a good repayment history. To expand her business, she wants to borrow a loan of 8,502,000 VND .

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Saran

texts.en: Mrs. Saran U. and her husband, Mr. SU.-eng Bou, live on an island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1983 and have two sons — one employed full time and the other one in school. Saran and her husband have been raising pigs and producing rice wine since they were married. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase food for her pigs and rice for making rice wine.

loans.use: To purchase food for pigs and rice for making rice wine.

Epifania joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 6000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.

Fidela M. is from the village of Mahinog, Camiguin Province. She is 57 years old and married with five school-aged children.
